result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael A. Shepard #178838 was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Michael A. Shepard #178838 was found guilty of Attempt Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must under anger management and/or psychological counseling and follow thru.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least two AA meetings per week.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and any vehicle titled in the defendant's name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

11:25 AM Defendant Michael A. Shepard in court with attorney Jeffery Joy both appearing by phone.  Defendant Michael A. Shepard in custody from Jackson Correctional Institution.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court - hearing held today due to Shepard's request for sentence adjustment, DA objected and court denied. Shepard sought further explanation. Court - informs party of statue for request being denied, the factors considered. Joy makes short statement. Shepard makes statement regarding his violations while incarcerated, has been trying to get job, just completed AODA, has certificates for the programs he has completed. Court questions Joy if he has the documents. Joy does have the certificates and wasn't sure if he was to send them to the court. Shepard continues, he has volunteered in Green Bay for his community service. Court does not have that information in file. Joy makes statement. Court questions why defendant is still in prison as sentence was 4 years of incarceration and 3 years of extended supervision. Joy indicates there was a case in Brown County that was consecutive. State confirms. Joy makes final argument, if he would have been made eligible for programming he may have then had it completed by now and asks the court to reconsider the sentence adjustment filed by Shepard. State - indicates why he objected. Court - confirms - does not grant sentence adjustment at this time and orders JOC to be amended to now allow the defendant eligible for programming.
Letter from Jackson Correctional Institution Social Worker informing court of Mr. Shepard's progress.
Hearing on July 22, 2019 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Called at 1:19 PM. Michael Shepard appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - have resolution - defendant would plead G to #1 as alleged - joint recommendation of 8 years in the WI State Prison System consiting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES, fine of $5000.00 inclusive, DL suspension of 36 months, #2 - DRI, #3 - DRI, #4 - amend to escape contrary to 946.42(3)(a) - class H felony - reads new charge and penalty - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to count #1, #5 - DRI, #6 - DRI - conditions to include: AODA and follow thru, anger management and/or psychological counseling and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, employment/school, 500 hours of community service, no operation of motor vehicle without a valid DL, not eligible for any early release programs (that condition not joint). Shepard and Joy agree. Shepard pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court amends count #1 to escape contrary to 946.472(3)(a) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3, #5 and #6. Defendant acknowledges 6 prior OWI convictions. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks that court not allow any earned release programs. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - requests challenge incarceration. Shepard makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 8 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of extended supervision - conseuctive to any term that he is currently serving; count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to count #1, conditions of ES/probation include: count #1 - fine of $5000.00 inclusive of costs - paid within first 6 months/CO, AODA and follow thru, anger management and/or psychological counseling and follow thru, 3 year DL revocation, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, attend at least two AA meetings per week, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, 500 hours of community service (one count 4 only), IID on DL and all vehicles titled in his name for 3 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL, not eligible for any early release programs; count #4 - costs (including DNA surcharge) - paid in 6 months/CO, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Called at 10:29 AM. Michael Shepard appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. Joy - asks that the matter be set for trial for stated reasons. Court responds, no bifurcating of charges. Court continues bond, informs the defendant that the plea offer is no longer valid, set for JT on 9/5/14 at 8:30 AM. (Matter may turn into a CT)
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael A. Shepard in court and in custody with attorney Jeffery A Joy.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:30 PM. Joy asks for sequestor of witnesses. Wilson sworn in 2:31 PM. Joy states they feel it was a warrant less stop, no reasonable suspision for stop. Bednar directs. Record reflects defendant has been identified 2:38 PM. Cross exam by Joy 2:38 PM. Re-direct by Bendar 2:51 PM. Wilson excused. Joy calls Deputy Hujet. State objects to Joy calling Deputy Hujet for stated reasons. Joy responds. Court over rules. Hujet sworn in 2:54 PM. Joy directs. Hujet excused 3:05 PM. Joy makes final argument to grant motion. Bednar requests motion to be denied. Court finds there was reasonable suspision for the stop and denies motion for stated reasons. Schedule Plea/sentencing hearing 7-16-14 at 10 a.m.

Called at 2:46 PM. Michael Shepard appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State has filed an Information that mirrors the complaint at this point due to waiver of PH but will be filing an amended information once the blood alcohol level comes in. Cirilli is aware that Jeff Joy has now taken over this case. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Joy has Information, waives reading, wants ARGN date and ability to appear telephonically. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 2/5/14 at 9:30 AM and Joy can appear telephonically.
